definition: to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China

sentences.english: Historically, most societies granted rights only to the lucky few.
sentences.chinese: 回顾历史，大多数社会只让极少数幸运者享有权利。

sentences.english: History says that banks bounce back from legal problems.
sentences.chinese: 回顾历史，大多银行能从法律纠纷中重振雄风。

sentences.english: Throughout history, many agrarian cultures have celebrated end-of-harvest festivals.
sentences.chinese: 回顾历史，许多农耕文化都有庆祝丰收节的传统。

sentences.english: Looking at history again suggests an answer.
sentences.chinese: 回顾历史，答案就在其中。

sentences.english: Therefore, in retrospect, we can conclude that Zhang Renjie was a man of vision.
sentences.chinese: 回顾历史，张人杰是一位有远见的人。

sentences.english: But it is hard, also, to think of a parallel in history.
sentences.chinese: 回顾历史，也很难找到与此相似的情境了。

definition: don't forget past events, they can guide you in future (idiom); benefit from past experience
pinyin: qian2 shi4 bu4 wang4 , hou4 shi4 zhi1 shi1

definition: Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria

national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
to think back over sth/to review/to revisit/to rethink/reflection/reassessment
to learn sth over again/to review/to brush up/to revive (memories, friendship etc)
much hardships may awaken a nation (idiom); calamity that prompts renewal
